title: 110_hr2417
content: The "Montgomery GI Bill Second Chance Act of 2007" allows active duty personnel to withdraw an election not to participate in the Montgomery GI Bill Education Program. The "Montgomery GI Bill Second Chance Act of 2007" allows qualified active-duty personnel to enroll in the basic educational assistance program during an annual open season in October, starting from 2007. The Secretary of each military department will establish procedures for individuals to make an irrevocable election under this section. The "Montgomery GI Bill Second Chance Act of 2007" allows qualified active-duty personnel to enroll in the basic educational assistance program during an annual open season in October. A qualified individual is someone who first became a member of the Armed Forces before or after July 1, 1985, has served on active duty without a break since then, is serving during the open season, and has completed secondary requirements before applying for benefits. The "Montgomery GI Bill Second Chance Act of 2007" allows qualified active-duty personnel to enroll in the basic educational assistance program during an annual open season in October. A qualified individual must have completed secondary school requirements or earned 12 semester hours towards a college degree. Upon discharge, the individual must have an honorable discharge. The enrollment fee involves a reduction in basic pay until it reaches $1,200. The Montgomery GI Bill Second Chance Act of 2007 allows qualified active-duty personnel to enroll in the educational assistance program during an annual open season in October. The enrollment fee involves a reduction in basic pay until it reaches $1,200, with options for payment or reduction in retired or retainer pay. The Secretary concerned shall provide for an 18-month period for the qualified individual to make payments. The Montgomery GI Bill Second Chance Act of 2007 allows qualified active-duty personnel to enroll in the educational assistance program. The Secretary concerned provides an 18-month period for payments to be made by the qualified individual. No educational assistance allowance shall be paid until the applicable amount is collected or retired/retainer pay is reduced. The Secretary concerned, in conjunction with the Secretary of Defense, must provide notice of the opportunity to elect basic educational assistance under this chapter. Conforming amendments are made to various sections of the title to include the provisions of section 3018D. The table of sections is amended by inserting new items after section 3018C, as per the provisions of section 3018D. Opportunity for certain active-duty personnel to enroll under section 3018D.
